definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: A bee setting on a flower has stung a child .
sentences.chinese: 一只落在一朵花上的密蜂螫了一个孩子。

sentences.english: In addition, massive wasp stings can also produce a lethal dose of venom in most adults.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，大量虎头峰螫到所产生的毒液也可致死。

sentences.english: When they reached the middle of the river, the scorpion stung the frog.
sentences.chinese: 当牠们到了河的中央，蝎子螫了青蛙。

sentences.english: My finger was hurt by a sting.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸满是被蜂螫的伤痕。

sentences.english: Their policies were like tails of poisonous scorpions stinging and agonizing people.
sentences.chinese: 这些政策就像毒蝎子的尾巴一样螫得人生不如死。

sentences.english: The Greek scientist, Pythagoras , used it as a remedy for scorpion stings.
sentences.chinese: 希腊科学家毕达哥拉斯把芥菜当作治疗蝎子螫伤的药。

sentences.english: A bee setting on a flower has stung a child.
sentences.chinese: 一只落在一朵花上的密蜂螫了一个孩子。

sentences.english: Treat wasp stings by removing stingers with a butter knife or credit card.
sentences.chinese: 通过删除或用信用卡黄油刀治疗蜂螫刺。

sentences.english: Even more victims die from allergic reactions to bee stings.
sentences.chinese: 更有甚者，一些受害者是对蜂螫伤的过敏反应而死。
